title: Grade 3
subject: College and Career Ready Standards for Literacy (CCRSL) (2017-)

document.title: College and Career Readiness Standards: Literacy Grade 3

65FBF8C215944D17950E9D7D13FBC9B1.description: Acquire and use accurately grade-appropriate conversational, general academic, and domain-specific words and phrases, including those that signal spatial and temporal relationships (e.g., After dinner that night we went looking for them).

9C67C6EEA3E3455FAF9DB4DF4C1D322A.description: Distinguish shades of meaning among related words that describe states of mind or degrees of certainty (e.g., knew, believed, suspected, heard, wondered).

F5CFD6D9765F4589B1B8451F2EFEBE45.description: Identify real-life connections between words and their use (e.g., describe people who are friendly or helpful).

E92B721512A94664A01F9ED2D93914ED.description: Distinguish the literal and nonliteral meanings of words and phrases in context (e.g., take steps).

3C887E148D6748CEB9DF71C8E82FBE83.description: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships and nuances in word meanings.

1955E31D30564BA89B05459A75CB40F5.description: Use glossaries or beginning dictionaries, both print and digital, to determine or clarify the precise meaning of key words and phrases.

77F84A83FBDE4160948FD3282A13F5EC.description: Use a known root word as a clue to the meaning of an unknown word with the same root (e.g., company, companion).

2AF24ACDBC1B47F09795A358FF1FD9C8.description: Determine the meaning of the new word formed when a known affix is added to a known word (e.g., agreeable/disagreeable, comfortable/uncomfortable, care/careless, heat/preheat).

FFC0EE4D95EF4E85BC1952C0F8E99EB7.description: Use sentence-level context as a clue to the meaning of a word or phrase.

5C4F9E0A374145419DE9C35C625670C7.description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning word and phrases based on grade 3 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a range of strategies.

A9219AF3BD754E0495AE5A7428500ADA.description: Recognize and observe differences between the conventions of spoken and written standard English.

A095230AD5E74255871291DF2CCE6AAF.description: Choose words and phrases for effect.*

C8DDA436F67448758AAE002F1CE895A5.description: Use knowledge of language and its conventions when writing, speaking, reading, or listening.

5AC72441DFDB426384EE7239349DB54D.description: Consult reference materials, including beginning dictionaries, as needed to check and correct spellings.

AD31A70A18FA451A8BA265909FCE6B7A.description: Use spelling patterns and generalizations (e.g., word families, position-based spellings, syllable patterns, ending rules, meaningful word parts) in writing words.

2D51D48B42084DF7AAE7C65676388C6F.description: Use conventional spelling for high-frequency and other studied words and for adding suffixes to base words (e.g., sitting, smiled, cries, happiness).

44A26269D2124255AA65B11B7FC3D339.description: Use commas and quotation marks in dialogue.

107B59CCBA274A39B1C06F095EE861BD.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing.

6C7E065F868A455AA9C7BA9E3E04406A.description: Produce simple, compound, and complex sentences.

1AA97EEE24ED48779EB7E7C7CB3A053F.description: Form and use comparative and superlative adjectives and adverbs, and choose between them depending on what is to be modified.

2FF7C740374B4975A3839FAB4F77CDB3.description: Form and use the simple (e.g., I walked; I walk; I will walk) verb tenses.

0D9F7D6049534980A816D2110AB0533D.description: Form and use regular and irregular verbs.

5455EBF5E98649CF8A3F2815C509FE98.description: Form and use regular and irregular plural nouns.

A9878BB352FE4F6F9EA84FCD993BDD80.description: Explain the function of nouns, pronouns, verbs, adjectives, and adverbs in general and their functions in particular sentences.

D700F19EBD0844BF9F7BFC2A5A1A33E7.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking.

CEB945B516A74A9EB289E462AB5FEDAD.description: Speak in complete sentences when appropriate to task and situation in order to provide requested detail or clarification.

B069E105E0044E608AFA0FE0355518B4.description: Create engaging audio recordings of stories or poems that demonstrate fluid reading at an understandable pace; add visual displays when appropriate to emphasize or enhance certain facts or details.

4BC28B3864AB42528FF144735A22F144.description: Report on a topic or text, tell a story, or recount an experience with appropriate facts and relevant, descriptive details, speaking clearly at an understandable pace.

75C0FE3430D949A18EFBFBF57243DCDD.description: Ask and answer questions about information from a speaker, offering appropriate elaboration and detail.

5E18281B93C44C2489694FB98A566ED2.description: Determine the main ideas and supporting details of a text read aloud or information presented in diverse media and formats, including visually, quantitatively, and orally.

3223921EDD1E412DA6D96F5FB84F8109.description: Explain their own ideas and understanding in light of the discussion.

15A11B4DA06F409799E0CDF749CFEBC1.description: Ask questions to check understanding of information presented, stay on topic, and link their comments to the remarks of others.

555F6E6392014B289C6B6BDA0889692C.description: Follow agreed-upon rules for discussions (e.g., gaining the floor in respectful ways, listening to others with care, speaking one at a time about the topics and texts under discussion).

50957B3626D24F6693E5A060A0DB21A5.description: Come to discussions prepared, having read or studied required material; explicitly draw on that preparation and other information known about the topic to explore ideas under discussion.

1F87DBF683EA47FA81B23DE4EE011A8C.description: Engage effectively in a range of collaborative discussions (one-on-one, in groups, and teacher-led) with diverse partners on grade 3 topics and texts, building on others’ ideas and expressing their own clearly.

48E94593EF7E457A8FADD90DEC43BBFF.description: Write routinely over extended time frames (time for research, reflection, and revision) and shorter time frames (a single sitting or a day or two) for a range of discipline-specific tasks, purposes, and audiences.

8BF551033C7148F98FB56A14E963DEE6.description: Recall information from experiences or gather information from print and digital sources; take brief notes on sources and sort evidence into provided categories.

6063FF373DB348F2B43EF4251C9052F0.description: Conduct short research projects that build knowledge about a topic.

D466F2A5593049CDB09C9825061A4D8F.description: With guidance and support from adults, use technology to produce and publish writing (using keyboarding skills) as well as to interact and collaborate with others.

C2F9640DC6544A2D8281E776FA04B51A.description: With guidance and support from peers and adults, develop and strengthen writing as needed by planning, revising, and editing.

EF672DFD4CE84EB29578E9A99B2BD60D.description: With guidance and support from adults, produce writing in which the development and organization are appropriate to task and purpose.

E759B440FBD844FB8F98AE0B049F0E96.description: Use temporal words and phrases to signal event order.

82F6DD5B53A5488CBF836DF9632684BC.description: Use dialogue and descriptions of actions, thoughts, and feelings to develop experiences and events or show the response of characters to situations.

9DF24A0684EF4A8CA8B94B1CE6D375EF.description: Establish a situation and introduce a narrator and/or characters; organize an event sequence that unfolds naturally.

5C24AE887E404065B7B0DD28CA315A83.description: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, descriptive details, and clear event sequences.

F587FD8DD8DF4BCA920309937CCE274F.description: Provide a concluding statement or section.

775D4D9AD4BE44F2870E02BE75FDE733.description: Use linking words and phrases (e.g., also, another, and, more, but) to connect ideas within categories of information.

8656CA0110F04E90A554602331E41527.description: Develop the topic with facts, definitions, and details.

A13801FB7C7144159CDF309431C0CDEA.description: Introduce a topic and group related information together; include illustrations when useful to aiding comprehension.

3D0DC256EE2A45C092615BAACD3DD385.description: Write informative/explanatory texts to examine a topic and convey ideas and information clearly.

1ED1D02B390440289D9A4E7D4B5A14A9.description: Provide a concluding statement or section.

1B633BBC63D843AE9ECA1F9D6D85A4B3.description: Use linking words and phrases (e.g., because, therefore, since, for example) to connect opinion and reasons.

BF04A37D886240B08AECEA234C954DEC.description: Provide reasons that support the opinion.

18263D2A992146C4980EFE20FC35FDEC.description: Introduce the topic or text they are writing about, state an opinion, and create an organizational structure that lists reasons.

C6D8DB3AC48A4DD9AB990CC90C5D9B62.description: Write opinion pieces on topics or texts, supporting a point of view with reasons.

AB945EB39422494FB6D8FFD58C688832.description: Use context to confirm or self-correct word recognition and understanding, rereading as necessary.

EBD018C364BA4C1FA11C0F13588C32D3.description: Read grade-level prose and poetry orally with accuracy, appropriate rate, and expression on successive readings.

EC731E2FAD9B4DBAB10F356353ED34A2.description: Read grade-level text with purpose and understanding.

F04DB12DFA0F4CEA9CE7925C6934875F.description: Read with sufficient accuracy and fluency to support comprehension.

6CEB5378FB5F4BF38300483A6B895461.description: Decode words with common Latin suffixes.

462AF71159D94D549305C51DF15F9650.description: Identify and know the meaning of the most common prefixes and derivational suffixes.

5C0F5DA5624547DEA1A6320F4D185582.description: Know and apply grade-level phonics and word analysis skills in decoding words.

E580C7C48D7A4B3192A8850522B54E0A.description: By the end of the year, read and comprehend informational texts, including history/social studies, science, and technical texts, at the high end of the grades 2–3 text complexity band independently and proficiently.

94F21608FF6244EA8B0638227CCB7F38.description: Compare and contrast the most important points and key details presented in two texts on the same topic.

024A15BF9A9346DB8B424EC91957F938.description: Describe the logical connection between particular sentences and paragraphs in a text (e.g., comparison, cause/effect, first/second/third in a sequence).

462AB779A7304EF18CCD112B1B34D332.description: Use information gained from illustrations (e.g., maps, photographs) and the words in a text to demonstrate understanding of the text (e.g., where, when, why, and how key events occur).

516A0F26E8AE45B2BF72D8E88B52FED0.description: Distinguish their own point of view from that of the author of a text.

8F99D6DC67F24CE28C23D59EAD1AC602.description: Use text features and search tools (e.g., key words, sidebars, hyperlinks) to locate information relevant to a given topic efficiently.

9D1E5FD53B0C4CD2AEFCAD6E840E5128.description: Determine the meaning of general academic and domain-specific words and phrases in a text relevant to a grade 3 topic or subject area.

42CEB9440F6142D7B7B8243981A90CBD.description: Describe the relationship between a series of historical events, scientific ideas or concepts, or steps in technical procedures in a text, using language that pertains to time, sequence, and cause/effect.

0F51FE542ADD443EB3FAB34A309324B2.description: Determine the main idea of a text; recount the key details and explain how they support the main idea.

ED89F1297C124803B8D12744B2F67F5C.description: Ask and answer questions to demonstrate understanding of a text, referring explicitly to the text as the basis for the answers.

C5D8F97D51E04AD3817EF0F920EB073A.description: By the end of the year, read and comprehend literature, including stories, dramas, and poetry, at the high end of the grades 2–3 text complexity band independently and proficiently.

38E9857C707C403295E074E11127F96A.description: Compare and contrast the themes, settings, and plots of stories written by the same author about the same or similar characters (e.g., in books from a series).

76B9D04E631D496BA77273C90B894B4C.description: Explain how specific aspects of a text’s illustrations contribute to what is conveyed by the words in a story (e.g., create mood, emphasize aspects of a character or setting).

6995CE773B80463EA2DDD51DAB6C73AB.description: Distinguish their own point of view from that of the narrator or those of the characters.

72B778EEE9C04DC886492350F484B91B.description: Refer to parts of stories, dramas, and poems when writing or speaking about a text, using terms such as chapter, scene, and stanza; describe how each successive part builds on earlier sections.

AB0B0779463846DC9431D0535587EF99.description: Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, distinguishing literal from nonliteral language.

49071EA4D2E7437DBBCA5FD9D7974264.description: Describe characters in a story (e.g., their traits, motivations, or feelings) and explain how their actions contribute to the sequence of events

2497FF0B7BC948D29FD996ED05F83AA1.description: Recount stories, including fables, folktales, and myths from diverse cultures; determine the central message, lesson, or moral and explain how it is conveyed through key details in the text.

616B6FDCDF6846208DA661E2D3C320D8.description: Ask and answer questions to demonstrate understanding of a text, referring explicitly to the text as the basis for the answers.

3E86E105200C4DB8966DB2116BF4FB7B.description: Read and comprehend complex literary and informational texts independently and proficiently.

7C05BD7771A44490BE6381E0FAC7F0E9.description: Analyze how two or more texts address similar themes or topics in order to build knowledge or to compare the approaches the authors take.

011F811708344E11BA47244E60F2BC0F.description: Delineate and evaluate the argument and specific claims in a text, including the validity of the reasoning as well as the relevance and sufficiency of the evidence.

75C054C1DC534111A771C77171573D1E.description: Integrate and evaluate content presented in diverse media and formats, including visually and quantitatively, as well as in words.

DCA88AEE7F3748FAB652B26D7D1D34B7.description: Assess how point of view or purpose shapes the content and style of a text.

19E60BE964194B1AB2C629F6367DAEF4.description: Analyze the structure of texts, including how specific sentences, paragraphs, and larger portions of the text (e.g., a section, chapter, scene, or stanza) relate to each other and the whole.

AC53EFE911D448C5ABCCC27A62818E5B.description: Interpret words and phrases as they are used in a text, including determining technical, connotative, and figurative meanings, and analyze how specific word choices shape meaning or tone.

D4832BB1D8E34D8AA5D9E441503C9FE1.description: Analyze how and why individuals, events, or ideas develop and interact over the course of a text.

0E626500E5F44F9DAAB990A874CA6FB7.description: Determine central ideas or themes of a text and analyze their development; summarize the key supporting details and ideas.

F2DD0C16967A4DCBB99CD7AAB497B5F9.description: Read closely to determine what the text says explicitly and to make logical inferences from it; cite specific textual evidence when writing or speaking to support conclusions drawn from the text.
